Plot Calibration Curve with Prediction Intervals

plot_calibration.Rd

Plot Calibration Curve with Prediction Intervals

Usage

plot_calibration(
  df,
  pgs,
  dep,
  covars = NULL,
  x_lab = "Predicted",
  y_lab = "Observed",
  conf_level = 0.95,
  annotation_size = 3,
  annotation_x = 0.05,
  annotation_y = 0.85
)

Arguments

df

A data.frame object, must contain pgs and dep.

pgs

PGS to include in model.

dep

Outcome variable, must be binary.

covars

Additional covariates to include in the model. Default: NULL.

x_lab

Text, x-axis. Default: "Predicted".

y_lab

Text, y-axis. Default: "Observed".

conf_level

Confidence level for prediction interval. Default: 0.95.

annotation_size

Font size in calibration metric text box. Default: 3.

annotation_x

x-axis position of the calibration metric text box. Default: 0.05.

annotation_y

y-axis position of the calibration metric text box. Default: 0.85.

Value

A ggplot object with the following annotated calibration metrics:

ICI

Integrated calibration index (average absolute difference)

E50

Median absolute difference

E90

90th percentile absolute difference

Emax

Maximum absolute difference

ECI

Estimated calibration index (average square difference)
